bug.short_desc: copr-backend contains systemd unit files under /usr/bin
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: copr-backend ships two sets of systemd unit files. One under /usr/lib/systemd/system (correct) and the other under /usr/bin/systemd (wrong).
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): copr-backend-1.94-1.fc25.noarch
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. rpm -ql copr-backend | grep systemd 2. 3.
Actual results: /usr/bin/systemd /usr/bin/systemd/copr-backend-log.service /usr/bin/systemd/copr-backend-vmm.service /usr/bin/systemd/copr-backend.service /usr/lib/systemd/system/copr-backend-log.service /usr/lib/systemd/system/copr-backend-vmm.service /usr/lib/systemd/system/copr-backend.service
Expected results: The three unit files should be in /usr/lib/systemd/system, and nowhere else.
Additional info:

Thanks for the report, upstream fix: https://pagure.io/copr/copr/c/9584903113c93937
This will be fixed once copr maintainers wrap a new update for copr-backend, is that enough, or is this causing some immediate issues?
copr-backend-1.95-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-8da0e210c5
copr-backend-1.95-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-b5e57a860c
copr-backend-1.95-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-8abd50b960

copr-backend-1.95-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-8abd50b960
